content: Is anyone else have issues with Confluence? We hare having trouble creating new pages with templates and adding labels to existing pages.
Was this today? About what time?
It's been for a few days now. We - Public Health work group - had reported the issue with templates earlier this week. I just tried to add a label to a page now with no success.
We were aware of issues with Create, but our version was end-of-lifed and I could not ask for support.
There were a series of upgrades that completed this morning.
We are now on the latest version of Confluence and encourage everyone to please keep going.
If there are issues that happen still, with create or anything, please let me know!
Also, I love the Public Health Work Group space, it's a great example of page tree usage for things like the meeting notes
The project list is really well done. Just glad to see the usage. Please take a look at the upgraded site. We now have Collaborative Editing! (we'll have to see how well it works... :-) )

...both are still issues. When trying to add a label to a page, we see a generic error message. And when we try to create a new page using a template, it just hangs. No templates (e.g. meeting notes, etc.) are presented as options.
okay, so you are seeing this right now in the public health work group. You want to create a page
May I ask what Browser version you are using?
I've tried with IE, Chrome and Safari.
When you tried with Chrome do you happen to know the version of Chrome?
Also, in Chrome, could you visit this site and tell me if Websockets are supported? http://websocket.org/echo.html
I really appreciate your patience on this, I'd like to work through the issue so it's fixed for everybody.
latest version of Chrome. And yes, websockets are supported
okay, well that's good news.
Those two things indicate you should be able to do this.
Can you try something else for me?
I know this sounds weird, but it would really help.
I understand you are logged into Confluence, right?
I can be
Just to be sure, you were when you were trying to create, right?
yes
Yeah, you must have been. No button otherwise. :-)
So while logged into confluence, I'd like to know if you could select the tri-menu and then select JIRA in the top left
Then with the same username and password log into JIRA
then use the tri-menu to come back to Confluence, and still logged in, select create.
that seems to work
okay, still a bug. and not a convenience to the user at all.
But what we've seen is that you have to be logged into JIRA in order to create in Confluence.
I'm going to report this to Atlassian (confluence vendor) immediately
Thank you very much for helping to debug this. We've been hoping to figure out a way to recreate it.
I'll probably post this on the main page of Confluence. It's very frustrating but people will need to know.
thanks
Thank you!
Anyone in Cologne: I'm considering a Confluence Restart but want to know current status of meeting
restarting, given permission from Wayne

There are known issues with updating pages/saving attachments in Confluence. Joshua Procious is aware of the issue and is researching a fix now. Confluence may be unavailable for brief periods while the issue is resolved.
Confluence is back online. If you have any questions or need assistance with data during a page load missing, please let me know here or at joshua@hl7.org.
Kudos to Josh for a successful JIRA upgrade this morning. And by kudos I mean...
Confluence is still undergoing an upgrade. Thank you for your patience. Approx time 1hour.
Thank you for your continued patience. Confluence new up time 12:00 PM EST
Confluence is back online. If you have any questions, please email joshua@hl7.org.
